intro: Cyclosorus incertus, commonly known as the uncertain cyclosorus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Peltasporaceae. It is a small, thalloid plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant's structure consists of a leafy thallus with a central axis and lateral branches, characteristic of many liverworts. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are borne on specialized stalks called sporophytes. Due to its limited distribution and morphological similarities to other species, Cyclosorus incertus remains a subject of taxonomic debate among botanists.
